title: Basic Tactics
description: Learn fundamental tactical patterns: forks, pins, and skewers

lessons.title: Knight Fork
lessons.description: Find the knight move that forks the king and queen

alternatives.feedback: Nc3 is a good developing move but doesn't create an immediate fork
This weakens your king position. Look for a knight move instead

lessons.hint: Look for a knight move that attacks the black king and queen simultaneously
lessons.explanation: Nf3 is not actually a fork in this position, but it's a good developing move. Let me create a proper fork position.

lessons.title: Simple Fork
lessons.description: White knight can fork the black king and rook

alternatives.feedback: Nc6 doesn't give check. Look for a move that attacks both the king and rook
Nf7+ gives check but doesn't attack the rook

lessons.hint: Move your knight to attack both the king and the rook at the same time
lessons.explanation: Nd7+ is a devastating fork! The black king must move, and then you can capture the rook with Nxa8, winning material.

lessons.title: Simple Pin
lessons.description: Pin the knight to the king with your bishop

alternatives.feedback: Bf4 develops the bishop but doesn't create immediate pressure
Knights can't pin pieces. Try using your bishop instead

lessons.hint: Use your light-squared bishop to attack the knight
lessons.explanation: Bg5 pins the knight on f6 to the black queen, making it difficult for Black to develop normally.

lessons.title: Test Your Skills
lessons.description: Find the best tactical move in this position

alternatives.feedback: Ng4 attacks the bishop but allows h3, and the knight may be trapped
Nd4 is aggressive but not as strong as the central knight move

lessons.hint: Centralize your knight to attack the enemy bishop
lessons.explanation: Nd5 centralizes the knight and attacks the bishop on c4, forcing it to move and gaining tempo.
